item.description: We do not have any change timestamp from the source (HR). Therefore we have to create our own.

mapping.name: usertemplate-activation-status-weak
mapping.description: Used to set initial (default) value. We want to create users in midPoitn as disabled regardless of their hrStatus.

mapping.name: usertemplate-activation
mapping.description: This is the real heart of the configuration. This mapping will force administrativeStatus value in accord with hrStatus. But it is delayed by one day (based on hrStatusChangeTimestamp timestamp).

script.code:
import com.evolveum.midpoint.xml.ns._public.common.common_3.ActivationStatusType import com.evolveum.midpoint.util.exception.SchemaException
switch (hrStatus) { case "enabled": return ActivationStatusType.ENABLED case "disabled": return ActivationStatusType.DISABLED case null: // also applied for "old" value when adding new object return ActivationStatusType.ENABLED default: throw new SchemaException("Wrong HR status: "+hrStatus) }
